column4: I have just made the jump to Ubuntu. Found an old install disk for breezy. Installed sweet. But, now, find that it's unsupported. :(
Currently downloading 6.06 . will that be a good install to use for a while?
that depends on your hardware and your usage scenario.... generally newer is better, and there's already  one year of the 3-year LTS-period over for dapper
what kind of box you got there?
I use it in my business. Web hosting etc.
oh, so for server use? yeah, should be the right choice. On the desktop side dapper starts to look oldish (firefox 1.5 e.g.)
I use limited server use. only developement.
Looking old is ok. I'm OLD!
given the rapid pace of OSS development i'd prefer feisty (7.04) you won't have fun develoing with outdated libs
is there anyway to update directly? Or, do I have to continue with this download and wait 6 hours to install this in place of the current one?
cancel the download... upgrading is only supported in incremental steps, edgy is a mess and and fresh install will be around 200 - 400 MB smaller than an upgraded install.
I'm downloading the full 'dapper' version, I think.
I am dl'ng from the ubuntu site. Which release do you want?
Well, gotta run. Thanks. email if I misunderstood. nichols@midrivers.com thanks again
